quiz.title: Chemistry: Unit 10 Quiz 1
quiz.subtitle: 10.1: Energy: Forms and Transformations
quiz.subject: Chemistry
quiz.topic: Types of energy in chemical systems

questions.question: Which type of energy is stored within the chemical bonds of a substance?
questions.explanation: Chemical potential energy is the energy stored in the arrangement of atoms and the bonds that hold them together.

questions.question: According to the Law of Conservation of Energy, energy can be:
options: Transformed from one form to another, but not created or destroyed.
Created when a high-energy explosion occurs.
Destroyed if a reaction is endothermic.
Converted into matter in a standard chemical reaction.
questions.explanation: Energy is always conserved; it simply shifts between potential, kinetic, heat, or other forms.

questions.question: The kinetic energy of the particles in a substance is directly related to its:
questions.explanation: Temperature is a measure of the average kinetic energy of the particles in a sample of matter.

questions.question: Heat is defined as the transfer of energy between two objects due to a difference in:
questions.explanation: Heat ($q$) always flows spontaneously from an object at a higher temperature to an object at a lower temperature.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an energy transformation from chemical to thermal energy?
questions.explanation: Combustion releases the potential energy stored in chemical bonds as heat (thermal energy).

questions.question: In chemistry, 'the system' usually refers to:
options: The specific chemicals participating in a reaction.
The beaker and the surrounding room air.
The thermometer used to measure heat.
questions.explanation: The system is the part of the universe being studied (the reaction), while everything else is the 'surroundings'.

questions.question: What is the SI unit for energy and heat?
questions.explanation: The Joule is the standard unit for energy. 1 calorie is equal to 4.184 Joules.

questions.question: Potential energy is 'energy of ______', while kinetic energy is 'energy of ______'.
questions.explanation: Potential energy is stored based on position or composition; kinetic energy is energy possessed by an object in motion.

questions.question: When a substance undergoes a phase change from liquid to gas, its particles:
questions.explanation: Adding heat increases the speed (kinetic energy) of the particles, allowing them to overcome attractive forces.

questions.question: Mechanical energy is the sum of which two types of energy?
questions.explanation: Mechanical energy refers to the total energy of an object due to its motion and its position.
